pQTLtools 0.1

Basic pQTL-MR analysis

pqtlMR.Rd

This function takes input based on pQTLs for MR analysis.

pqtlMR(TwoSampleMRinput, plot=FALSE, prefix="pQTL-combined-",reverse=FALSE)

Arguments

TwoSampleMRinput

Harmonised data
plot

to produce plots
prefix

a prefix for output files
reverse

if TRUE, perform reverse MR

Details

This function is based on TwoSampleMR.

Value

No value is returned but several files.

References

Zheng J, et al. (2020). Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases. *Nature Genetics* 52(10): 1122-1131.

Note

Adapted from script by Jie Zheng

Examples

library(TwoSampleMR)

#> TwoSampleMR version 0.5.6 
#> [>] New: Option to use non-European LD reference panels for clumping etc
#> [>] Some studies temporarily quarantined to verify effect allele
#> [>] See news(package='TwoSampleMR') and https://gwas.mrcieu.ac.uk for further details
library(pQTLtools)
# Original examples
ins <- read.csv(file.path(find.package("pQTLtools",lib.loc=.libPaths()),"tests","Ins.csv"))
ids <- c("ieu-a-7","ebi-a-GCST007432")
Ins <- format_data(ins)
Ids <- extract_outcome_data(snps=with(Ins,SNP),outcomes=ids)

#> API: public: http://gwas-api.mrcieu.ac.uk/
#> Extracting data for 2 SNP(s) from 2 GWAS(s)
harmonise <- harmonise_data(Ins,Ids)

#> Harmonising ABO (ImbABK) and FEV1 || id:ebi-a-GCST007432 (ebi-a-GCST007432)
#> Harmonising LIFR (Ku3B84) and FEV1 || id:ebi-a-GCST007432 (ebi-a-GCST007432)
#> Harmonising ABO (ImbABK) and Coronary heart disease || id:ieu-a-7 (ieu-a-7)
#> Harmonising LIFR (Ku3B84) and Coronary heart disease || id:ieu-a-7 (ieu-a-7)
input <- list(Ins, Ids, harmonise)
pqtlMR(input,plot=FALSE)

#> Error in if (empty(.data)) return(.data) : 
#>   missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed
#> Error in TwoSampleMR::mr_singlesnp(harmonise) : 
#>   "outcome" %in% names(dat) is not TRUE
# A bidirectional analysis
ms <- read.table(file.path(find.package("pQTLtools",lib.loc=.libPaths()),"tests","ms.ins"),
                 header=TRUE)
Ins <- format_data(ms,samplesize_col="N")
Ids <- extract_outcome_data(snps=with(Ins,SNP),outcomes="ieu-b-18")

#> Extracting data for 2 SNP(s) from 1 GWAS(s)
#> Finding proxies for 1 SNPs in outcome ieu-b-18
#> Extracting data for 1 SNP(s) from 1 GWAS(s)
harmonise <- harmonise_data(Ins,Ids)

#> Harmonising TNFB (G6vQ58) and multiple sclerosis || id:ieu-b-18 (ieu-b-18)
# MR
pqtlMR(harmonise,prefix="MS-")

#> Analysing 'G6vQ58' on 'ieu-b-18'
# reverse MR
pqtlMR(harmonise,prefix="MS_rev-",reverse=TRUE)

#> Analysing 'ieu-b-18' on 'G6vQ58'
